  • Method Details

    • addHardClause

      org.sat4j.specs.IConstr addHardClause​(org.sat4j.specs.IVecInt literals) throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Add a hard clause in the solver, i.e. a clause that must be satisfied.
      Parameters:
      literals - the clause
      Returns:
      the constraint is it is not trivially satisfied.
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException

    • addSoftClause

      org.sat4j.specs.IConstr addSoftClause​(org.sat4j.specs.IVecInt literals) throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Add a soft clause in the solver, i.e. a clause with a weight of 1.
      Parameters:
      literals - the clause.
      Returns:
      the constraint is it is not trivially satisfied.
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException

    • addSoftClause

      org.sat4j.specs.IConstr addSoftClause​(int weight, org.sat4j.specs.IVecInt literals) throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Add a soft clause to the solver. if the weight of the clause is greater of equal to the top weight, the clause will be considered as a hard clause.
      Parameters:
      weight - the weight of the clause
      literals - the clause
      Returns:
      the constraint is it is not trivially satisfied.
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException

      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
